<title level="1" right="Spell 2" pfs="Standard">[Entangle](/Spells.aspx?ID=103)</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Plant" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=125" />
<trait label="Transmutation" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=157" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Core Rulebook](/Sources.aspx?ID=1) pg. 336 <sup>4.0</sup></row>

**Tradition**
[Primal](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=4)

**Deities**
[Green Man](/Deities.aspx?ID=221), [Nhimbaloth](/Deities.aspx?ID=163), [Nhimbaloth](/Deities.aspx?ID=163)

<row gap="medium">

<row gap="tiny">
<row>**Cast**</row>
<row><actions string="Two Actions" /></row>
<row>[somatic](/Rules.aspx?ID=283), [verbal](/Rules.aspx?ID=284)</row>
</row>

</row>

<row gap="medium">
**Range** 120 feet

**Area** all squares in a 20-foot-radius burst that contain plants or fungi

</row>

<row gap="medium">

**Duration** 1 minute
</row>

</column>

---

Plants and fungi in the area entangle creatures. The area counts as difficult terrain. Each round that a creature starts its turn in the area, it must attempt a Reflex save. On a failure, it takes a –10-foot circumstance penalty to its Speeds until it leaves the area, and on a critical failure, it is also immobilized for 1 round. Creatures can attempt to Escape at _entangle_'s DC to remove these effects.
